intro: Millettia lastoursvillensis, commonly known as the lastoursvillensis legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant produces elongated, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
